page.title: 13SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: In this area 35% of the population are elderly. They do not have free bus passes, but if an elderly person is on Supplementary benefit they will get Â£15 a year in bus tokens. There are three sorts of special accommodation for the elderly: MUIR HOUSE is 50 self-contained flats 26 single and 24 double, and a warden's bungalow. Each flat has a bathroom, kitchen and a large bedsitting room in the singles and a sittling room and bedroom in the doubles. The warden is on call 24 hours a day. ASHDEAN is a rest home where they have their own room, but meals are cooked for them and the cleaning done, etc. LITTLE HAVEN is a nursing home where the person can get 24 hours a day care and attention. The COUSINS DAY CENTRE is somewhere they can do handicrafts and meet friends.
